a.title: Return to the homepage on the district site.

li.a: Forest Lake Area Community School (formerly ALC)

div.p: Information, lessons and resources for distance learning. Distance Learning will run from April 1 to May 4, unless extended by the Governor.

a.title: Go to comments for Distance Learning

div.p: Resources, companies and services to help get families connected

a.title: Go to comments for Technology Access

div.p: Resources to help essential workers find childcare while students are out of school

a.title: Go to comments for Childcare Assistance

div.p: Resources to help our families meet essential needs.

a.title: Go to comments for Food and Family Resources

div.p: Updates and information about events and activities cancelled or rescheduled during the COVID-19 pandemic.

a.title: Go to comments for Cancellations and Schedule Changes

h1.span: Extended School Closure and Distance Learning announced

div.div: Posted by Forest Lake Area Schools on 3/25/2020 4:00:00 PM

p.span: This afternoon, Governor Walz announced that schools will continue to be closed through May 4, and that Distance Learning in Minnesota will begin next week. At the end of our current spring break, Forest Lake Area Schools will transition to Distance Learning beginning on Wednesday, April 1.

We understand this can be a stressful time for our students and families as we begin this new model of learning. Please be assured that our teachers have been working hard to provide a meaningful distance education for their students, and that our entire district staff is ready to support students and families through this process.
As you begin to think about next week, please visit our district’s

(flaschools.org/covid) for information about Distance Learning and what you and your students can do to be prepared for next week’s learning. Specific lessons and activities will not be available until April 1, but there are steps that families can take now to make sure they are ready to get started.

For parents who work in emergency/essential occupations, our district will continue to provide childcare for enrolled students of Forest Lake Area Schools. You can find more information about childcare resources on our
We recognize that this pandemic situation is creating new hardships for many families. We have created a
that may be of help to many families. In addition, if you or your family is struggling, please feel free to reach out to your

a.aria-label: Go to comments for Extended School Closure and Distance Learning announced

span.p: This site will be your centralized location for the latest information and resources during the COVID-19 pandemic regarding all school programs and resources.
If you would like general information and news about the general COVID-19 outbreak, we suggest you visit these reliable public health websites:

p.a: Centers for Disease Control (CDC) COVID page
Minnesota Department of Health COVID information page

a.span: Will the spring sports season be cancelled?

span.p: At this time, MSHSL activities are suspended through May 4, but spring sports seasons have NOT been cancelled. Participants should register for their sport/activity as they normally would. If seasons are eventually cancelled, refunds will be given to those who registered.

a.title: Go to comments for Will the spring sports season be cancelled?

span.p: Prom was originally scheduled for April 4th. At this time, Prom has been cancelled with hopes that it can be rescheduled for May 30th if circumstances allow.

a.title: Go to comments for What about Prom?

a.span: Will Summer School go on as scheduled?

span.p: At this time, the district is planning to operate our Summer School program as usual. We are processing student registrations and continuing with plans to provide this important program. If this should change, we will communicate directly with families who have registered for summer school, and we will provide updated information on this website.

a.title: Go to comments for Will Summer School go on as scheduled?
